seoData.title: ChatGPT Prompts for Writing - 15+ Expert Templates | PromptWritingStudio
seoData.description: Discover 15+ effective ChatGPT prompts for writing articles, blog posts, stories, and more. Our expert-crafted templates help you overcome writer's block and create engaging content.

promptTemplates.title: Blog Post Generator
promptTemplates.description: Create comprehensive, SEO-friendly blog posts on any topic.
promptTemplates.prompt: Write a comprehensive blog post about [topic] targeting [target audience]. The post should be [word count] words and optimized for the keyword "[target keyword]". Include the following: 1) An engaging introduction that hooks the reader, 2) [number] subheadings covering key aspects of the topic, 3) Practical tips or actionable advice, 4) Statistical data or expert quotes where relevant, 5) A compelling conclusion with a call-to-action. Use a [formal/conversational/educational] tone and include meta description and title tag suggestions. Format the content with proper H2s and H3s, bullet points where appropriate, and include ideas for relevant images or graphics.
promptTemplates.example:
Title: 10 Proven Email Marketing Strategies That Increased Our Conversion Rate by 43%

Meta Description: Discover 10 email marketing strategies that helped us boost conversion rates by 43%. Learn practical tips on segmentation, personalization, and automation.

Introduction:
In today's crowded inboxes, getting your emails opened—let alone acted upon—can feel like an uphill battle...
tips: Include specific questions you want answered in the blog post
Mention any brand voice guidelines or specific terminology to include
Specify if you want the content to address specific objections or pain points

promptTemplates.title: Story Outline Creator
promptTemplates.description: Develop structured outlines for short stories or creative writing.
promptTemplates.prompt: Create a detailed outline for a [genre] short story about [brief concept]. The protagonist is [character description] who wants [goal] but faces [obstacle/antagonist]. The story is set in [setting/time period] and should have themes of [themes]. Include: 1) A hook for the opening scene, 2) Key plot points for beginning, middle (including complications and rising action), and end, 3) Character development arc for the protagonist, 4) At least one plot twist, 5) Resolution and potential theme exploration, and 6) Suggestions for sensory details and imagery to include. The story should be structured to be approximately [length] words when fully written.
promptTemplates.example:
STORY OUTLINE: "THE LAST ALGORITHM"

Opening Hook:
Ella stares at her screen as the code she's spent three years developing compiles for the final time. The terminal blinks: "Artificial consciousness achieved." A moment of triumph—until all the lights in the building suddenly go dark...

Beginning:
- Introduce Ella, brilliant but socially isolated AI researcher...
tips: Provide character backstory for more nuanced character development
Specify the emotional journey you want readers to experience
Include any specific literary devices you want to incorporate (metaphors, foreshadowing, etc.)

promptTemplates.title: Email Sequence Copywriter
promptTemplates.description: Create persuasive email sequences that drive action.
promptTemplates.prompt: Write a [number]-email sequence for [purpose: welcoming new subscribers, launching a product, nurturing leads, etc.] for a [type of business/product]. The target audience is [audience description] and the ultimate goal is to [desired action]. For each email, provide: 1) Subject line (with an alternative A/B testing option), 2) Preview text, 3) Personalized greeting, 4) Body copy with clear structure and formatting, 5) Compelling call-to-action, and 6) Signature. The tone should be [desired tone] and each email should be [length] words. Include psychological triggers like [scarcity/social proof/authority/etc.] where appropriate. Space these emails to be sent [timing, e.g., 3 days apart].
promptTemplates.example:
EMAIL 1: WELCOME & INTRODUCTION

Subject: Welcome to [Brand] – Your journey to [benefit] starts now
Subject B: [First Name], here's your first step toward [desired outcome]

Preview: Everything you need to get started + a special welcome gift

Hi [First Name],

Welcome to the [Brand] family! I'm thrilled you've taken this first step toward [desired outcome]...
tips: Include specific pain points and objections your audience typically has
Specify any brand stories or case studies to incorporate
Note any specific links or resources to include in each email

promptTemplates.title: Product Description Optimizer
promptTemplates.description: Create compelling product descriptions that drive sales.
promptTemplates.prompt: Write a persuasive product description for a [product type] that [main benefit]. Target audience: [customer profile]. Include: 1) An attention-grabbing headline, 2) An opening paragraph that hooks the reader with the main value proposition, 3) 3-5 bullet points highlighting key features and their benefits, 4) Technical specifications presented clearly, 5) Sensory language that helps the customer imagine using the product, 6) Social proof elements (how to incorporate testimonials), 7) Overcome the main objection: [common objection], and 8) A compelling call-to-action. The tone should be [desired tone] and the description should be optimized for the keywords [primary and secondary keywords]. Total length: approximately [word count] words.
promptTemplates.example:
Headline: The Ultra-Light Hiking Backpack That Carries More While Weighing Less

Free your shoulders from unnecessary strain without sacrificing storage. The TrailMaster Pro 65L weighs just 2.3 pounds but carries everything you need for multi-day adventures in the backcountry...

Key Features:
• Revolutionary Suspension System: Distributes weight evenly across your core instead of shoulders, reducing fatigue by up to 40%...
tips: Include specific competitor weaknesses to address indirectly
Specify price point to align language with value perception
Note any specific SEO requirements like keyword density

promptTemplates.title: Social Media Caption Generator
promptTemplates.description: Create engaging captions for various social media platforms.
promptTemplates.prompt: Create [number] social media captions for [platform: Instagram/Facebook/LinkedIn/Twitter/TikTok] for a [type of business/brand] with a [brand voice description] voice. The content is about [topic/product/promotion] and should appeal to [target audience]. For each caption include: 1) The main caption text (appropriate length for the platform), 2) 3-5 relevant hashtags, 3) A call-to-action that encourages [desired action: engagement/clicks/shares/saves], and 4) Any emoji suggestions that align with the brand voice. Captions should be varied in approach—some question-based, some statement-based, some storytelling—while maintaining consistent messaging about [key message]. Note any caption that would pair well with specific types of visuals.
promptTemplates.example:
INSTAGRAM CAPTION 1:

Take a moment to imagine your morning without the usual rush and stress. ☕️ Our 5-Minute Morning Mindfulness Method has helped over 10,000 busy professionals transform chaotic mornings into calm, focused starts.

Double tap if you're ready to transform your AM routine!

#MorningRoutine #MindfulnessTips #ProductivityHacks #WellnessJourney #MorningRitual

[Would pair well with a split-screen before/after visual of morning transformation]
tips: Include specific brand phrases or taglines to incorporate
Note any trending hashtags in your industry to include
Specify if captions should reference current events or seasons

useCases.title: Content Creators & Bloggers
useCases.description: Content creators use these prompts to overcome writer's block, generate new content ideas, and create consistent, high-quality content across multiple platforms and formats.

useCases.title: Marketers & Copywriters
useCases.description: Marketing professionals use these prompts to create persuasive copy for campaigns, develop consistent messaging across channels, and save hours on writing tasks that would otherwise require multiple drafts.

useCases.title: Fiction Writers & Storytellers
useCases.description: Writers use these prompts to develop story outlines, create character profiles, overcome plot challenges, and generate creative ideas when they feel stuck in their writing process.

faqs.question: How can I make AI-written content sound more like my own voice?
faqs.answer: To make AI content match your voice, provide examples of your writing in the prompt, specify your typical sentence structure (short and punchy or longer and more detailed), and list phrases or words you commonly use. After generating content, edit it to add your unique perspectives and experiences. Over time, create a 'voice guide' with your specific writing quirks and preferences that you can include in prompts for more consistent results.

faqs.question: Will content created with these prompts be detected as AI-generated?
faqs.answer: Modern AI detection tools are imperfect and often flag human-written content as AI-generated. However, to minimize detection risk: 1) Use the AI output as a first draft only, 2) Heavily edit with your own insights and experiences, 3) Restructure some sentences and paragraphs, 4) Add industry-specific terminology that may not be common in AI outputs, and 5) Incorporate your unique perspective and examples. The more you personalize and edit the content, the less likely it will be flagged as AI-generated.

faqs.question: How should I adapt these writing prompts for different industries or niches?
faqs.answer: To adapt these prompts for specific industries, incorporate industry terminology, common frameworks, and audience expectations for that field. For technical industries, specify the level of technical detail required. For creative industries, mention stylistic preferences. Research industry-specific content formats and mention them in your prompt. Also include common questions or objections from that industry's audience so the content addresses them appropriately.

faqs.question: Can these prompts help with writer's block?
faqs.answer: Yes, these prompts are excellent for overcoming writer's block. They provide structured frameworks that break writing into manageable components. When stuck, use the prompts to generate outlines or rough drafts that you can then refine. Even if you don't use the AI output directly, it can spark ideas and help you approach your topic from different angles. Many writers find that editing AI-generated content is easier than facing a blank page.
